Line 33: Line 33:
==Storylines==
==Storylines==
â
[[File:Joe viki 1974.png|thumb|left|Joe and [[Victoria Lord|Viki]] ([[Erika Slezak]]) remarry, 1974]]
 
In 1968, reporter Joe Riley clashed with icy heiress [[Victoria Lord|Viki Lord]], who had little interest in romance and focused her time and energy on her work at ''The Banner''. They soon started falling in love, but publisher [[Victor Lord]] disapproved of his daughter becoming involved with the working-class Riley and did all he could to keep them apart. Torn between pleasing her father and following her heart, Viki began getting headaches — and mysterious, threatening notes telling her to end her relationship with Joe.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://abc.go.com/daytime/onelifetolive/episodes/1968-69/1968.html |title=''One Life to Live'' recap (1968) |publisher=[[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] |accessdate=October 30, 2011 |archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20080423033131/http://abc.go.com/daytime/onelifetolive/episodes/1968-69/1968.html |archivedate=April 23, 2008}}</ref>
In 1968, reporter Joe Riley clashed with icy heiress [[Victoria Lord|Viki Lord]], who had little interest in romance and focused her time and energy on her work at ''The Banner''. They soon started falling in love, but publisher [[Victor Lord]] disapproved of his daughter becoming involved with the working-class Riley and did all he could to keep them apart. Torn between pleasing her father and following her heart, Viki began getting headaches — and mysterious, threatening notes telling her to end her relationship with Joe.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://abc.go.com/daytime/onelifetolive/episodes/1968-69/1968.html |title=''One Life to Live'' recap (1968) |publisher=[[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]] |accessdate=October 30, 2011 |archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20080423033131/http://abc.go.com/daytime/onelifetolive/episodes/1968-69/1968.html |archivedate=April 23, 2008}}</ref>
